name: Fighter
description: Fighter is a character Class in Baldur's Gate 3. Fighters use their martial expertise to fight enemies and support their allies in combat. Fighters use Strength or Dexterity as their primary ability score.

action.name: Second Wind
action.summary: Second Wind is a Fighter Bonus Action. This ability allows them to heal themselves in the midst of battle.
action.description: Draw on your stamina to protect yourself. You regain 1d10 + Fighter Level|Healing.

action.name: Action Surge
action.summary: Action Surge is a Free Action gained by Fighters at Level 2. This ability allows the Fighter to take another action in the same turn.
action.description:
Available only in combat.

Immediately gain an extra action to use this turn.

options.name: Battle Master
options.description: Battle Masters are paragons of tactical superiority, combining combat manoeuvres  and experience in the field to dominate every fight.

options.name: Champion
options.description: You approach the complex problems posed by combat with one distinctly effective solution - you hit those problems, really quite hard.

grants.name: Improved Critical Hit
grants.description: The number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

options.name: Eldritch Knight
options.description: Eldritch Knights study magic to supplement their weaponry, allowing them to overcome resistance from the toughest foes.
options.image: Class Fighter Eldritch Knight Badge Icon.png

action.name: Weapon Bond
action.summary: Weapon Bond is an Eldritch Knight action. This prevents the Fighter's main hand weapon from being disarmed and makes it automatically return to the Fighter when thrown.
action.description: Ritually bind the weapon in your main hand. The weapon can't be knocked out of your hand, and it automatically returns to you when Thrown.

action.name: Acid Splash
action.summary: It deals Acid damage to enemies in a small area.
action.description: Throw a bubble of acid that damages each creature it hits.
action.notes: * In BG3, this cantrip is the only direct offensive area of effect option without the expenditure of resources that can be done on a per turn basis
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 2d6|Acid.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 3d6|Acid.

action.name: Blade Ward
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to become more resilient against physical damage.
action.description: Take only half the damage from Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing attacks.

action.name: Bone Chill
action.summary: It deals Necrotic damage and prevents the target from regaining Hit Points.
action.description: Prevent the target from healing until your next turn. An undead target receives Disadvantage on Attack Rolls.
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 2d8|Necrotic.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 3d8|Necrotic.

action.name: Dancing Lights
action.summary: It creates magical orbs of light that brighten an area.
action.description: Illuminate a m=9|ft=30 radius.

action.name: Fire Bolt
action.summary: It allows the caster to hurl a bolt of fire at an enemy.
action.description: Hurl a mote of fire.
action.notes:
* High Elf and High Half-Elf versions are from the Wizard spell list and scale hit rate off of Intelligence. You need to explicitly choose the class version to scale off of a separate stat.
** For example: for Sorcerer when selecting the spell in the keyboard interface this will be designated with CHA for the Sorcerer version that scales off of Charisma and INT for the race (Wizard) version that scales off of Intelligence.
action.higherLevels:
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d10|Fire Fire|1d10 Fire damage, for a total of 2d10|Fire.
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d10|Fire Fire|1d10 Fire damage, for a total of 3d10|Fire.

action.name: Friends
action.summary: It makes the caster appear more charismatic to the affected creature.
action.description:
Gain Advantage on Charisma Checks against a non-hostile creature.

In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.
action.notes: If cast on companions, they will lose 10 approval when the effect ends, regardless of difficulty.

action.name: Light
action.summary: It makes an object shed light in a small area.
action.description: Infuse an object with an aura of light. Only affects one target at a time.
action.notes: * When cast on a character, it will apply the effect to their active weapon.

action.name: Mage Hand
action.summary: It conjures a spectral hand that can interact with objects.
action.description:
Create a spectral hand that can manipulate and interact with objects.

Duration: 10 turns.

This cantrip can only be cast once per short rest.
action.notes: * Githyanki and Arcane Tricksters can cast a special version of Mage Hand that is invisible.

action.name: Minor Illusion
action.summary: It conjures a simple illusion to distract creatures.
action.description:
Create an illusion that compels nearby creatures to investigate.

You can remain hidden while casting this spell.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

Duration: 10 turns.
action.notes:
* Illusions can cast a special version of Minor Illusion as a Bonus Action.
* Outside of combat, causes most NPCs to walk towards the illusion and surround it.
* During combat, this causes enemies to turn towards the illusion.
* Springs traps if cast on top of the trap
* Placed on top of a vent it prevents gas from coming out
* Will disappear if you concentrate on another spell, but will not break concentration for existing spells

action.name: Poison Spray
action.summary: This cantrip allows spellcasters to deal Poison damage to a target.
action.description: Project a puff of noxious gas, dealing 1d12|Poison to a target.
action.higherLevels:
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d12|Poison Poison|1d12 Poison damage, for a total of 2d12|Poison.
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d12|Poison Poison|1d12 Poison damage, for a total of 3d12|Poison.

action.name: Ray of Frost
action.summary: It deals Cold damage to the target and slows it down.
action.description: Reduces the target's Movement Speed by m=3|ft=10.
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases to 2d8|Cold.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases to 3d8|Cold.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
action.summary: It makes a melee attack that inflictsLightning damage and prevents the target from taking Reactions.
action.description: The target cannot use Reactions. This spell has Advantage on creatures with metal Armour.
action.notes: Characters with the War Caster: Opportunity Spell|War Caster feat can cast this cantrip on enemies moving out of their melee range as a reaction, even if they don't know this spell.
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases to 2d8|Lightning.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases to 3d8|Lightning.

action.name: True Strike
action.summary: The caster gains Advantage on their next Attack Roll against the target.
action.description: Gain Advantage on your next Attack Roll.
action.notes:
* This cantrip is also granted to Rangers who pick Mage Breaker as their Favoured Enemy at level 1.
* The description of True Strike is among the more confusingly worded, and thus is prone to being misunderstood. To wit:
** Only the caster of this spell gains Advantage on their next attack against the affected target, never their allies.
** Only the first attack roll following the application of the condition gains Advantage. The condition is removed immediately afterward, whether the attack roll is a hit or a miss.
** The duration is 2 turns, but this includes the turn on which the condition is applied. This is true of many spells, but is especially important for short duration spells.
* True Strike is rarely considered worth using due to its opportunity cost; a full action must be spent on it to improve the chances of hitting once. Most of the time, if two actions are available (whether on the same turn or not), attacking twice is more effective than attacking once with advantage due to damage bonuses.
* However, True Strike is not considered aggressive, so the caster could cast it just before combat to gain its benefits without having to spend an action mid-fight. This eliminates the opportunity cost. Note that the duration is only 2 turns (12 seconds while not in turn-based mode).
* Another niche use case exists for an Arcane Trickster making a Sneak Attack (Melee)|Sneak Attack. If the caster is out of spell slots, and no allies can flank for a sneak attack, and there is no other way to gain advantage for an attack roll, spending a single action on True Strike to enable a single sneak attack can be considered efficient.
** In such cases, True Strike can be even more useful when using the Sneak Attack (Ranged)|ranged version of sneak attack, since this allows the caster to benefit from the range of the cantrip, especially with a High Ground bonus. At such distances, however, it is typically easier to just use a Bonus Action to hide first and obtain Advantage.

action.name: Burning Hands
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies.
action.description:
Each flammable target is hit with 3d6|Fire Fire|damage.

On Save: Targets still take half damage.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Red (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional Fire|1d6 Fire damage per level.

action.name: Chromatic Orb
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fire a ball of energy and deal the desired damage type to enemies.
action.description:
Hurl a sphere of energy.

It deals 3d8|Thunder damage, or 2d8 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Poison damage and creates a surface.
action.notes: * Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Book of Ancient Secrets}} at level 7+. When gained in this way, the spell can be cast once per [[Long Rest and doesn't expend Spell Slots.
action.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra d8|Physical 1d8 damage of the chosen type for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Thunder

* Even though the tooltip description says it Poisons creatures, it instead just deals Poison damage instead.

action.name: Magic Missile
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hit enemies with multiple projectiles that deal Force damage.
action.description:
Create three darts of magical force, each dealing 1d4 + 1|Force damage to its target.

The darts always hit their target, and can each be targeted individually.
action.notes:
* The Shield spell causes the caster to take no damage from Magic Missile.
* The level 10 Evocation feature Empowered Evocation will add the wizard's intelligence modifier to each missile.
* When interacting with effects like Death Ward and dealing multiple attacks to the same creature, if the 1st attack was sufficient to Downed|down the target, the 2nd attack will apply beforeDeath Ward activates leaving the target with 1HP. An action with three attacks, however, would result in the creature being downed. A player character with Death Ward applied would need to receive 6 attack applications to fully die: 2 to break the ward, 1 to get downed, then 3 more to fail 3 Death Saving Throws. This effect seems to apply to all multi-application attacks such Scorching Ray and Eldritch Blast (as of 4.1.1.3669438).
action.higherLevels: When the spell is cast at 2nd Level or higher, an additional dart is created for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Mage Armour
action.summary: This spell allows unarmoured spellcasters to surround themselves with magical protection.
action.description:
Surround an unarmoured creature in a protective magical force. Its Armour Class increases to 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Prerequisite: The target can't be wearing Armour.

action.name: Protection from Evil and Good
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to surround themselves with magical protection against Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead.
action.description:
Protect an ally against the attacks and powers of Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead.

The targets can't be Charmed, Frightened, or possessed by them, and when these creatures attack it, they have Disadvantage.
action.notes: * Granted to Rangers who pick Keeper of the Veil as their Favoured Enemy at level 1. Long Rest

action.name: Shield
action.summary:
This spell allows spellcasters to avoid being hit by an enemy attack at the last possible instant. It also completely nullifies Magic Missile.

See also: Shields for the Equipment type.
action.description: When you are about to be hit by an enemy, use your Reaction to increase your Armour Class by 5. You also take no damage from Magic Missile. These effects last until the start of your next turn.

action.name: Thunderwave
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to project out a deafening force that can hit multiple creatures and objects. Creatures hit by this force are potentially pushed away from the spellcaster.
action.description: Release a wave of thunderous force that pushes away all creatures and objects in an area, while also dealing Thunder damage.
action.notes: * If an affected creature passes the SavingThrow, in addition to only taking half damage, they are also not pushed back.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Thunder damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Witch Bolt
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to hit enemies with a blue ray of electrifying energy that deals Lightning damage to them initially and also on subsequent turns.
action.description: Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional 1d12|Lightning each turn by activating it.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Blue (Lightning) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: The initial damage increases by 1d12|Lightning per level.

action.name: Burning Hands
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies.
action.description:
Each flammable target is hit with 3d6|Fire Fire|damage.

On Save: Targets still take half damage.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Red (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional Fire|1d6 Fire damage per level.

action.name: Charm Person
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature, granting Advantage on Charisma Checks.
action.description:
Charm a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain Advantage on Charisma Checks in dialogue.

Enemies have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed.

Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Chromatic Orb
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fire a ball of energy and deal the desired damage type to enemies.
action.description:
Hurl a sphere of energy.

It deals 3d8|Thunder damage, or 2d8 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Poison damage and creates a surface.
action.notes: * Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Book of Ancient Secrets}} at level 7+. When gained in this way, the spell can be cast once per [[Long Rest and doesn't expend Spell Slots.
action.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra d8|Physical 1d8 damage of the chosen type for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Colour Spray
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily blind enemies with flashing coloured light, making their attacks miss more often and shortening their attack range.
action.description: Blinded|Blind creatures up to a combined Healing|33 Hit Points.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level increases the number of targets by 1 and total Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Disguise Self
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily change their appearance. While active, gain access to the action Dispel Disguise to end the effect.
action.description: Magically change all aspects of your appearance.
action.notes:
* Draconic Bloodline of Gold (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
* Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Eldritch Invocation Mask of Many Faces at level 2+.
* Can be used to gain race specific bonuses on equipment and dialogue options if the player disguises as the corresponding race.
* Since the spell changes Creature Size it can be used to fit through some entrances with size requirements.
* Allows using Speak with Dead on creatures you've killed yourself.

action.name: Expeditious Retreat
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to move more swiftly.
action.description: Gain Dash immediately and as a bonus action on each of your turns until this spell ends.

action.name: False Life
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to gain Temporary Hit Points.
action.description:
Bolster yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life to gain 7.

Can only have Temporary Hit Points from one source.
action.notes: * Also granted to Fiendish Vigour}} at level 2+. When gained in this way, the spell can be cast at will and doesn't expend [[Spells#Spell Slots|Spell Slots.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level yields an extra 5 for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Feather Fall
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to make themselves and their allies light as a feather, preventing them from taking damage when falling from extreme heights.
action.description: You and nearby allies gain Immunity to Falling damage.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Silver (Cold) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.

action.name: Find Familiar
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a fey familiar that can aid them in combat or world exploration.
action.description: Summon a familiar, a fey spirit that takes an animal form of your choosing
action.notes: * The raven is the only standard familiar given a specific name: "Quothe". This is a reference to Edgar Allen Poe's poem "The Raven", and probably also the raven Quoth who appears in Terry Pratchett's Discworld novels (himself a reference to "The Raven").

action.name: Fog Cloud
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to summon a sphere of fog on an area in range and heavily obscure the area. Creatures within the area are Blinded.
action.description: Create a cloud of dense fog to Heavily Obscured|Heavily Obscure and Blinded|Blind creatures within.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Bronze (Lightning) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Affects a larger area when cast with Spell Slots of higher Level.

action.name: Grease
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to conjure flammable grease on the ground within range and turn it into Difficult Terrain.
action.description: Cover the ground in flammable grease. It becomes Difficult Terrain and creatures within can fall Prone.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Black (Acid) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.

action.name: Ice Knife
action.summary: The caster throws a shard of ice, which explodes and leaves behind an icy surface.
action.description:
Throw a shard of ice that deals 1d10|Piercing damage. It explodes and deals 2d6|Cold damage to anyone nearby. It leaves an Ice Surface. On miss, the shard of ice still explodes.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.
action.notes: * Creatures on an Prone}} on failing a [[Dexterity SavingThrow.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d6|Cold damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Enhance Leap
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to increase a creature's Jumping distance.
action.description: Triple a creature's Jumping distance.
action.notes: * When this spell is gained through the Githyanki racial ability, it can only be cast once per Long Rest

action.name: Longstrider
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to make a creature move farther during a turn.
action.description: Increase a creature's Movement Speed by m=3|ft=10.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Ray of Sickness
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hit enemies with a ray of nauseating energy that deals Poison damage, and potentially Poisons them.
action.description: Possibly Poisoned|Poisons the target.
action.notes:
* Draconic Bloodlines of Green (Poison) Ancestry learn this spell automatically.
* Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Book of Ancient Secrets}} at level 7+. When gained in this way, the spell can be cast once per [[Long Rest and doesn't expend Spell Slots.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Poison damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Shield
action.summary:
This spell allows spellcasters to avoid being hit by an enemy attack at the last possible instant. It also completely nullifies Magic Missile.

See also: Shields for the Equipment type.
action.description: When you are about to be hit by an enemy, use your Reaction to increase your Armour Class by 5. You also take no damage from Magic Missile. These effects last until the start of your next turn.

action.name: Sleep
action.summary: It allows the spellcaster to temporarily make conscious creatures fall into a deep slumber.
action.description:
Put creatures into a magical slumber. Select targets up to a combined 24 Hit Points.

The condition ends upon taking damage.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Affect creatures with more hit points at higher levels. The total hit points of creatures this spell can affect is increased by 8 hit points per level.

action.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to send a targeted creature into a fit of laughter, falling Prone.
action.description:
Leave a creature Prone with laughter, without the ability to get up.

The creature must have an Intelligence of 5 or more.
The target can try to shake off the effect each time it takes damage.

action.name: Thunderwave
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to project out a deafening force that can hit multiple creatures and objects. Creatures hit by this force are potentially pushed away from the spellcaster.
action.description: Release a wave of thunderous force that pushes away all creatures and objects in an area, while also dealing Thunder damage.
action.notes: * If an affected creature passes the SavingThrow, in addition to only taking half damage, they are also not pushed back.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Thunder damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Witch Bolt
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to hit enemies with a blue ray of electrifying energy that deals Lightning damage to them initially and also on subsequent turns.
action.description: Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional 1d12|Lightning each turn by activating it.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Blue (Lightning) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: The initial damage increases by 1d12|Lightning per level.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

grants.name: Ability Improvement
grants.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Actor
options.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

grants.name: Actor
grants.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Alert
options.description:
Alert|w=30
:* You gain a +5 bonus to Surprised.

grants.name: Alert
grants.description: You gain +5 to Initiative and can no longer be surprised.

options.name: Athlete
options.description:
Athlete: Standing Up|w=30
:* Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance also increases by 50%.

grants.name: Athlete: Standing Up
grants.description: When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance also increases by 50%.

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

grants.name: Charger

options.name: Crossbow Expert
options.description:
Crossbow Expert: Point-Blank|w=30
:* When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

Crossbow Expert: Wounding|w=30 
:* Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

grants.name: Crossbow Expert
grants.description:
Crossbow Expert: Point-Blank|w=30
:* When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

Crossbow Expert: Wounding|w=30 
:* Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

options.name: Defensive Duellist
options.description:
Defensive Duellist|w=30
:* When you are attacked with a melee attack while wielding a Finesse Weapon you are Proficient in, you can use a Reaction to increase your ArmourClass by your Proficiency Bonus, possibly causing the attack to miss.

grants.name: Defensive Duellist
grants.description: When you are attacked with a melee attack while wielding a Finesse Weapon you are Proficient in, you can use a Reaction to increase your ArmourClass by your Proficiency Bonus, possibly causing the attack to miss.

options.name: Dual Wielder
options.description:
Dual Wielder: Bonus Armour Class|w=30
:* You have a +1 bonus to ArmourClass while wielding a melee weapon in each hand.

Dual Wielder|w=30
:* You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if your weapons aren't Light You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

grants.name: Dual Wielder: Bonus Armour Class
grants.description: You have a +1 bonus to ArmourClass while wielding a melee weapon in each hand.

grants.name: Dual Wielder
grants.description: You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if the weapons you are wielding aren't Light. You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

options.name: Dungeon Delver
options.description:
Dungeon Delver: Perception|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on Perception checks made to detect hidden objects and on SavingThrows made to avoid or resist traps.

Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps|w=30
:* You gain Resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

grants.name: Dungeon Delver: Perception
grants.description: You have Advantage on Perception Checks made to detect hidden objects.

grants.name: Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps
grants.description: You have Advantage on Saving Throws made to avoid traps and Resistance to trap damage.

options.name: Durable
options.description:
Durable|w=30
:* Constitution increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Regain full Hit Points every time you take a Short Rest.

grants.name: Durable
grants.description: Regain full Hit Points every time you take a Short Rest.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Cold
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Cold damage. In addition, when you deal Cold damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. In addition, when you deal Lightning damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Fire damage. In addition, when you deal Fire damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Thunder damage. In addition, when you deal Thunder damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Great Weapon Master
options.description:
Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When an attack with a melee weapon lands a Critical Hit or kills a creature, you can make another melee weapon attack as a Bonus Action that turn.

Great Weapon Master: All In|w=30
:* When attacking with a Two-Handed or Versatile melee weapon (in both hands) that you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus that turn.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
grants.description: When attacking with Heavy melee weapons you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

options.name: Heavily Armoured
options.description:
Heavily Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with HeavyArmour.

grants.name: Heavily Armoured
grants.description:
You gain Proficiency with Heavy Armour and your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You must have Medium Armor Proficiency before you can take this feat.

options.name: Heavy Armour Master
options.description:
Heavy Armour Master|w=30
:* Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

grants.name: Heavy Armour Master
grants.description:
Your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

Requires Proficiency with Heavy Armour

options.name: Lightly Armoured
options.description:
Lightly Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with LightArmour.

grants.name: Lightly Armoured
grants.description: You gain Armour Proficiency with Light Armour and your Strength and Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Bard
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Bard|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Bard spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Bard
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Bard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Charisma.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Cleric
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Cleric|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Cleric spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Wisdom.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Cleric
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Cleric spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Wisdom.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Druid
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Druid|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Druid spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Wisdom.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Druid
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Druid spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Wisdom.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Sorcerer
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Sorcerer|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Sorcerer spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Sorcerer
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Sorcerer spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Charisma.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Warlock
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Warlock|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Warlock spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Warlock
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Warlock spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Charisma.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Wizard
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Wizard|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Wizard spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Intelligence.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Wizard
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Wizard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Intelligence.

options.name: Martial Adept
options.description:
Martial Adept|w=30
:* Learn two manoeuvres from the Short or Long Rest.

grants.name: Martial Adept
grants.description: Learn two manoeuvres from the Battle Master archetype and receive 1 (additional) supdie to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a Short or Long Rest.

options.name: Medium Armour Master
options.description:
Medium Armour Master|w=30
:* When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

grants.name: Medium Armour Master
grants.description:
When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to ArmourClass you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

You must have Proficiency in Medium Armor to take this feat

options.name: Mobile
options.description:
* Your Movement Speed increases by m=3|ft=10.

Mobile: Evade Difficult Terrain|w=30
:* When you use the Dash action, Difficult Terrain doesn't slow you down.

Mobile: Evade Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke an Opportunity Attack from that target.

grants.name: Mobile
grants.description:
* Your Movement Speed increases by m=3|ft=10.

Mobile: Evade Difficult Terrain|w=30
:* When you use the Dash action, Difficult Terrain doesn't slow you down.

Mobile: Evade Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke an Opportunity Attack from that target.

options.name: Moderately Armoured
options.description:
Moderately Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with MediumArmour and Shields.

grants.name: Moderately Armoured
grants.description:
You gain Proficiency with Medium Armour and Shields, and your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You must have Light Armor Proficiency before you can take this feat.

options.name: Performer
options.description:
* Increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Gain Musical Instrument Proficiency.

grants.name: Performer
grants.description:
* Increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Gain Musical Instrument Proficiency.

options.name: Polearm Master
options.description:
Polearm Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When attacking with a Glaive, Halberd, Quarterstaff, or Spear, you can use a Bonus Action to attack with the butt of your weapon. 
:* Note: This attack deals 1d4 + Weapon Ability Modifier damage.

Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

grants.name: Polearm Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description:
When attacking with a Glaive, Halberd, Quarterstaff, or Spear, you can use a Bonus Action to attack with the butt of your weapon. 
This attack does 1d4|Bludgeoning|modifier=melee

grants.name: Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack
grants.description: You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

options.name: Resilient
options.description:
Resilient|w=30
:* You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency in that ability's SavingThrows.
:* Note: this increase does apply to a druid in wild shape.

grants.name: Resilient
grants.description:
You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Gain Proficiency in that ability's SavingThrow.

options.name: Ritual Caster
options.description:
Ritual Caster: Free Spells|w=30
:* You learn two Ritual_Spell_Icon|24px Ritual Spells of your choice.
:* Note: the spell must be one of these:
:** Enhance Leap
:** Disguise Self
:** Find Familiar
:** Longstrider
:** Speak with Animals
:** Speak with Dead

grants.name: Ritual Caster: Free Spells
grants.description:
You learn two Ritual_Spell_Icon|24px Ritual Spells of your choice from the following: 
* Speak with Dead
* Find Familiar
* Longstrider
* Enhance Leap
* Disguise Self
* Speak with Animals

options.name: Savage Attacker
options.description:
Savage Attacker|w=30
:* When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

grants.name: Savage Attacker
grants.description: When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

options.name: Sentinel
options.description:
Sentinel: Vengeance|w=30
:* When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

Sentinel: Snare|w=30
:* When you hit a creature with an Attack of Opportunity, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

grants.name: Sentinel: Vengeance
grants.description: When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

grants.name: Sentinel: Snare
grants.description: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

grants.name: Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage
grants.description: You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

options.name: Sharpshooter
options.description:
Sharpshooter: Low Ground|w=30
:* Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

Sharpshooter: All In|w=30
:* Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Sharpshooter: Low Ground
grants.description: Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

grants.name: Sharpshooter: All In
grants.description:
Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.
(This is a toggleable passive effect)

options.name: Shield Master
options.description:
Shield Master|w=30
:* Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

Shield Master: Block|w=30
:* If a Spell forces you to make a Dexterity Saving Throw, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
:* Notes:
:** On a failed save, you only take half damage.
:** On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

grants.name: Shield Master
grants.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

grants.name: Shield Master: Block
grants.description:
If a Spell forces you to make a DEX, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

options.name: Skilled
options.description:
Skilled|w=30
:* You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

grants.name: Skilled
grants.description: You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

options.name: Spell Sniper
options.description:
Spell Sniper|w=30
:* You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
:* Notes:
:** The cantrip you learn must be one of these:
:*** Bone Chill
:*** Eldritch Blast
:*** Fire Bolt
:*** Ray of Frost
:*** Shocking Grasp
:*** Thorn Whip
:** These cantrips do scale with character level, just like a spellcaster's cantrips.

grants.name: Spell Sniper
grants.description:
You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

The cantrip must be one of:
* Bone Chill
* Eldritch Blast
* Fire Bolt
* Ray of Frost
* Shocking Grasp
* Thorn Whip

options.name: Tavern Brawler
options.description:
Tavern Brawler|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your strength modifier is added twice to the damage and Attack Rolls.Bug

grants.name: Tavern Brawler
grants.description:
Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.

When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your Strength Modifier is added twice to the damage and Attack Rolls.Bug

options.name: Tough
options.description:
Tough|w=30
:* Hit Point maximum increased by 2 for each level.

grants.name: Tough
grants.description: Your Hit Point maximum increases by 2 for every level you have gained.

options.name: War Caster
options.description:
War Caster: Concentration|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on SavingThrows to maintain Concentration on a Spell.

War Caster: Opportunity Spell|w=30
:* You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.
:* Note: this feat does not grant the cantrip Shocking Grasp. Unless you know it from another source, you can only  cast it as an Attack of Opportunity.

grants.name: War Caster: Concentration
grants.description: You gain Advantage on SavingThrows to maintain Concentration on a Spell.

grants.name: War Caster: Opportunity Spell
grants.description: You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.

options.description:
Weapon Master|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Cold
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Cold damage. In addition, when you deal Cold damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. In addition, when you deal Lightning damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Fire damage. In addition, when you deal Fire damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Thunder damage. In addition, when you deal Thunder damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Great Weapon Master
options.description:
Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When an attack with a melee weapon lands a Critical Hit or kills a creature, you can make another melee weapon attack as a Bonus Action that turn.

Great Weapon Master: All In|w=30
:* When attacking with a Two-Handed or Versatile melee weapon (in both hands) that you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus that turn.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
grants.description: When attacking with Heavy melee weapons you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

options.name: Battle Master
options.description: Battle Masters are paragons of tactical superiority, combining combat manoeuvres  and experience in the field to dominate every fight.

options.name: Champion
options.description: You approach the complex problems posed by combat with one distinctly effective solution - you hit those problems, really quite hard.

grants.name: Remarkable Athlete: Jump
grants.description: You're a master of your own body, your athletic prowess extended beyond the usual. Your Jump distance is increased by m=3|ft=10.

grants.name: Remarkable Athlete: Proficiency
grants.description: You're a master of your own body, your athletic prowess extended beyond the usual. You can add half of your Checks that you are not Proficient in.

options.name: Eldritch Knight
options.description: Eldritch Knights study magic to supplement their weaponry, allowing them to overcome resistance from the toughest foes.
options.image: Class Fighter Eldritch Knight Badge Icon.png

grants.name: War Magic
grants.description: You have honed your body and magic for war. After you cast a cantrip, you can make a weapon attack using a bonus.

action.name: Arcane Lock
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically lock a container.
action.description: * Close a door or container with a magical lock. It can no longer be lockpicked or opened with Knock.

action.name: Darkness
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a cloud of darkness in an area within range that obscures and Blinded|blinds those within it.
action.description: Create a cloud of magical darkness that Heavily Obscured|Heavily Obscures and Blinded|Blinds creatures within. Creatures cannot make ranged attacks into or out of it.
action.notes:
* Drow, Drow Half-Elfs, and Asmodeus Tieflings can only cast the spell once per Long Rest.
* Way of Shadows gain the ability to cast this spell at level 3, at the cost of 2Monk_Ki_IconKi Points.
* Effects that grant sight in magical darkness, such as the Warlock Eldritch Invocation Devil's Sight, Eversight Ring from act 2, and Helldusk Helmet from act 3, allow ranged attacks into and out of this spell's area.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

action.name: Gust of Wind
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a squall to clear dangerous gasses or throw creatures back, potentially causing a dangerous fall.
action.description: Summon a strong wind that clears all clouds. Any creatures caught in the gale who fail a Strength SavingThrow will be pushed back ft=17 and be thrown Off Balance.
action.notes:
* Granted by Amulet of Windrider. Short Rest
* A successful SavingThrow means that a creature is neither pushed back, nor goes Off Balance
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

action.name: Melf's Acid Arrow
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to shoot a magical arrow that deals Acid|Acid damage to a target on impact and at the end of its next turn.
action.description:
Shoot a green arrow that bursts in a spray of acid. Deals 4d4|Acid damage immediately and 2d4|Acid damage at the end of the target's next turn.

If the spell misses, the target still takes half the initial damage, but no damage at the end of its next turn.
action.notes: * Can be cast with Melf's First Staff once per Long Rest. The spell uses a caster's existing spellcasting ability modifier, or otherwise uses Charisma as its casting modifier for a character without a spellcasting ability modifier.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 2d4|Acid damage (1d4|Acid on impact and at the end of target's turn) for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

action.name: Scorching Ray
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hurl 3 rays of fire at targets within range. You can either target a single creature or multiple creatures with the rays. Each ray rolls a separate Attack Roll and deals Fire damage.
action.description: Hurl 3 rays of fire. Each ray deals 2d6|Fire damage.
action.notes:
* Granted by Circlet of Blasting. Long Rest
* Also granted by Gloves of Cinder and Sizzle. Long Rest
* Also granted by Hellfire Hand Crossbow as a 3rd level spell. Short Rest
* A target afflicted by Hex will take an additional 1d6|Necrotic damage from each ray.
* When interacting with effects like Death Ward and dealing multiple attacks to the same creature, assuming the 1st attack was sufficient to Downed|down the target the 2nd attack appears to apply before the Death Ward activates, which means that after 2 attacks the target would lose the Death Ward but remain with 1HP. If the initial attack would have 3 applications then the target would be Downed|downed on 1st attack and again on 3rd attack. In case of Avatars it means that, whilst having a Death Ward applied, they would need to receive 6 attack applications to fully die: 2 to break down the ward, 1 to get downed and 3 more to fail 3 Death Saves. This effect seems to apply to all multi-application attacks, like Magic Missile and Eldritch Blast (as of 4.1.1.3669438).
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level hurls an additional ray for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

action.name: Shatter
action.summary: This spell allows the spellcaster to generate a deafening noise explosion that can damage multiple creatures and objects. This spell is extra potent against inorganic targets, who must make their Saving Throw at Disadvantage.
action.description:
Damages all nearby creatures and objects. Creatures made of inorganic material such as stone have Disadvantage on their SavingThrow. 

On Save: Targets still take half damage.
action.notes: * Granted by  Sentient Amulet (Rare) and Sentient Amulet (Very Rare).
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Thunder damage for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

options.name: Great Weapon Master
options.description:
Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When an attack with a melee weapon lands a Critical Hit or kills a creature, you can make another melee weapon attack as a Bonus Action that turn.

Great Weapon Master: All In|w=30
:* When attacking with a Two-Handed or Versatile melee weapon (in both hands) that you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus that turn.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
grants.description: When attacking with Heavy melee weapons you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

options.name: Heavily Armoured
options.description:
Heavily Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with HeavyArmour.

grants.name: Heavily Armoured
grants.description:
You gain Proficiency with Heavy Armour and your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You must have Medium Armor Proficiency before you can take this feat.

options.name: Heavy Armour Master
options.description:
Heavy Armour Master|w=30
:* Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

grants.name: Heavy Armour Master
grants.description:
Your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

Requires Proficiency with Heavy Armour

grants.description: Learn two manoeuvres from the Battle Master archetype and receive 1 (additional) supdie to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a Short or Long Rest.

options.name: Medium Armour Master
options.description:
Medium Armour Master|w=30
:* When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

grants.description:

options.name: Polearm Master
options.description:
Polearm Master: Bonus Attack|w=30

:* Note: This attack deals 1d4 + Weapon Ability Modifier damage.

Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

grants.name: Polearm Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description:
When attacking with a Glaive, Halberd, Quarterstaff, or Spear, you can use a Bonus Action to attack with the butt of your weapon. 
This attack does 1d4|Bludgeoning|modifier=melee

grants.name: Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack

Resilient|w=30

grants.name: Resilient
grants.description:
You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Gain Proficiency in that ability's SavingThrow.

:** Enhance Leap

:** Find Familiar
:** Longstrider
:** Speak with Animals
:** Speak with Dead

grants.description:
You learn two Ritual_Spell_Icon|24px Ritual Spells of your choice from the following: 
* Speak with Dead
* Find Familiar
* Longstrider
* Enhance Leap
* Disguise Self
* Speak with Animals

Savage Attacker|w=30

grants.name: Savage Attacker

options.name: Sentinel
options.description:
Sentinel: Vengeance|w=30
:* When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

Sentinel: Snare|w=30
:* When you hit a creature with an Attack of Opportunity, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

grants.name: Sentinel: Vengeance
grants.description: When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

grants.name: Sentinel: Snare
grants.description: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

grants.name: Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage
grants.description: You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

options.name: Sharpshooter

Sharpshooter: Low Ground|w=30

Sharpshooter: All In|w=30
:* Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.

options.name: Shield Master
options.description:
Shield Master|w=30
:* Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

Shield Master: Block|w=30
:* If a Spell forces you to make a Dexterity Saving Throw, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
:* Notes:
:** On a failed save, you only take half damage.
:** On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

grants.name: Shield Master
grants.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

grants.name: Shield Master: Block
grants.description:
If a Spell forces you to make a DEX, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

options.name: Skilled
options.description:
Skilled|w=30
:* You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

grants.name: Skilled
grants.description: You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

options.name: Spell Sniper
options.description:
Spell Sniper|w=30
:* You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
:* Notes:
:** The cantrip you learn must be one of these:
:*** Bone Chill
:*** Eldritch Blast
:*** Fire Bolt
:*** Ray of Frost
:*** Shocking Grasp
:*** Thorn Whip
:** These cantrips do scale with character level, just like a spellcaster's cantrips.

grants.name: Spell Sniper
grants.description:
You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

The cantrip must be one of:
* Bone Chill
* Eldritch Blast
* Fire Bolt
* Ray of Frost
* Shocking Grasp
* Thorn Whip

Tavern Brawler|w=30

War Caster: Concentration|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on SavingThrows to maintain Concentration on a Spell.

War Caster: Opportunity Spell|w=30
:* You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.
:* Note: this feat does not grant the cantrip Shocking Grasp. Unless you know it from another source, you can only  cast it as an Attack of Opportunity.

grants.name: War Caster: Opportunity Spell
grants.description: You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.

grants.name: Weapon Master
grants.description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.

grants.name: Indomitable
grants.description: Whenever you fail a Saving Throw, you can roll again, using the new result instead.

options.name: Battle Master
options.description: Battle Masters are paragons of tactical superiority, combining combat manoeuvres  and experience in the field to dominate every fight.

grants.name: Improved Combat Superiority
grants.description: The size of your supdie increases to a d10|Physical d10

options.name: Champion
options.description: You approach the complex problems posed by combat with one distinctly effective solution - you hit those problems, really quite hard.

grants.name: Archery
grants.description: You gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls you make with ranged Weapons.

grants.name: Defence
grants.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Armour Class while wearing Armour.

grants.name: Duelling
grants.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon that is not Two-Handed or Versatile in one hand, and no weapon in the other, you deal an additional 2 damage with that weapon.

grants.name: Great Weapon Fighting
grants.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack with a Two-Handed melee weapon, that die is rerolled once.

grants.name: Protection
grants.description: When you have a Shield, impose Disadvantage on an enemy who attacks one of your allies when you are within melee. You must be able to see the enemy.

grants.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
grants.description: When you make an offhand attack, you can add your Ability Score Modifier to the damage of the attack.

options.name: Eldritch Knight
options.description: Eldritch Knights study magic to supplement their weaponry, allowing them to overcome resistance from the toughest foes.
options.image: Class Fighter Eldritch Knight Badge Icon.png

grants.name: Eldritch Strike
grants.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, it has Disadvantage on its next Saving Throw against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

grants.name: Improved Extra Attack
grants.description: You can make two additional attacks after attacking with your main-hand weapon.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

grants.name: Ability Improvement
grants.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Actor
options.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

name: Monk
description: Monk is a character Class in Baldur's Gate 3. Monks are unarmed combatants capable of spending Ki Points to perform special abilities. Monk's key ability scores are Wisdom, Dexterity, and Constitution.

grants.name: Unarmoured Defence (Monk)
grants.description: Your reflexes are as effective as any Wisdom Modifier to your ArmourClass.

grants.name: Martial Arts: Dextrous Attacks
grants.description: Attacks with Monk Weapons and unarmed attacks scale with your Dexterity instead of your Strength if your Dexterity is higher.

grants.name: Martial Arts: Deft Strikes
grants.description: Attacks with Monk Weapons and unarmed attacks deal 1d4|Bludgeoning damage, unless their normal damage is higher.

grants.name: Martial Arts: Bonus Unarmed Strike
grants.description: After making an attack with a Monk Weapon or while unarmed, you can make another unarmed attack as a bonus action.

action.summary: PAGENAME is a bonus that allows the Monk to deal two unarmed strikes at their opponent. This skill does not have to come after an Attack or an action.
action.description: Punch twice in quick succession.

grants.name: Unarmoured Movement
grants.description: Your movement speed increases by m=3|ft=10 while you are not wearing armour or using a shield.

progression.undefined: Patient Defence}},Step of the Wind: Dash, Step of the Wind: Disengage

options.name: Way of Shadow
options.description: You value the arts of stealth and subterfuge, bending the shadows to your will to strike without warning.

action.name: Minor Illusion
action.summary: It conjures a simple illusion to distract creatures.
action.description:
Create an illusion that compels nearby creatures to investigate.

You can remain hidden while casting this spell.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

Duration: 10 turns.
action.notes:
* Illusions can cast a special version of Minor Illusion as a Bonus Action.
* Outside of combat, causes most NPCs to walk towards the illusion and surround it.
* During combat, this causes enemies to turn towards the illusion.
* Springs traps if cast on top of the trap
* Placed on top of a vent it prevents gas from coming out
* Will disappear if you concentrate on another spell, but will not break concentration for existing spells

action.name: Shadow Arts: Hide
action.summary:
PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow Bonus Action. This ability allows Monks to use their Bonus Action to Hiding (Condition)|Hide from view.

For the Rogue version of this skill, see Cunning Action: Hide
action.description: Hide from enemies by succeeding at Stealth checks. Stick to the dark and avoid enemy sightlines. Attacking or casting a spell will reveal your location.

action.name: Shadow Arts: Pass Without Trace
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow Action. This ability allows Monks to grants themselves and nearby allies a bonus to stealth. This action is the Monk's equivalent of the spell Pass Without Trace
action.description: Call forth a veil of shadow and silence that gives you and nearby allies a +10 bonus to Checks.

action.name: Shadow Arts: Darkness
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow Action. This ability allows Monks to conjure a cloud of darkness in an area within range that obscures and Blinds those within it.
action.description: Create a cloud of magical darkness that Heavily Obscured|Heavily Obscures and Blinded|Blinds creatures within. Creatures cannot make ranged attacks into or out of it.

action.name: Shadow Arts: Darkvision
action.description: Grant a creature the ability to see in the dark out to a range of m=12|ft=40.

action.name: Shadow Arts: Silence
action.summary:
PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow Action. This ability allows Monks to summon a sphere of absolute quietness in an area within range. Creatures within this sphere are immune to Thunder damage and cannot cast verbal spells.

:For the Level 2 spell, see {{SAI|Silence.}}
action.description: Create a sound-proof sphere. All within are Immune to Thunder damage.

options.name: Way of the Four Elements
options.description: You focus your ki to bend the elements to your will, using them as an extension of your own body.
options.image: Class Monk Four Elements Badge Icon.png

action.name: Blade of Rime
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to use their equivalent of Ice Knife by expending ki|forceplural=yes instead of Spell Slots.
action.description:
Throw a shard of ice that deals 1d10|Piercing damage. It explodes and deals 2d6|Cold to anyone nearby. It leaves an ice surface.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced|Silenced.

action.name: Chill of the Mountain
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to hit with cold damage and reduce the movement speed of their opponent. This action is the Monk's equivalent of Ray of Frost.
action.description: Call forth the cold mountain winds and reduce the target's movement speed by ft=10.

action.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to hit an enemy, dealing unarmed damage with 1d10|Fire, and deal an extra 1d4|Fire damage on their next melee attack.
action.description: Hit foes from afar.  Your next melee attacks deal an additional 1d4|Fire damage.

action.name: Fist of Four Thunders
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to push creatures and objects away. It is the Monk equivalent of Thunderwave.
action.description: Release a wave of thunderous force that pushes away all creatures and objects.
action.notes: When creatures succeeds in saving, they will not be pushed back, but will still take half the damage.

action.name: Fist of Unbroken Air
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to punch an enemy at distance, sending them flying backwards..
action.description: Push the target back m=6|ft=20 and knock it Prone (Condition)|Prone.

action.name: Rush of the Gale Spirits
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to conjure a squall to clear dangerous gasses or throw creatures back, potentially causing a dangerous fall. This action is the Monk's equivalent of Gust of Wind
action.description: Summon a strong wind that clears all clouds and pushes creatures back m=5|ft=17, forcing them Off Balance (Condition)|Off Balance.

action.name: Shaping of the Ice
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to create an ice cube that can be climbed.
action.description: Create a climbable ice cube.

action.name: Sphere of Elemental Balance
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to create a sphere that channels different elements. This action is the Monk's equivalent of Chromatic Orb.
action.description:
Hurl a sphere of energy.

It deals 3d8|Thunder damage, or 2d8 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Poison damage and creates a surface.

action.name: Sweeping Cinder Strike
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies. This is the Monk's equivalent of Burning Hands.
action.description: Expel fire from your outstretched hands and ignite anything flammable.

action.name: Touch of the Storm
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to strike nearby enemies with lightning, causing them to be unable to use reactions. This is the Monk's equivalent of Shocking Grasp.
action.description: The target cannot use reactions. This spell has Advantage on creatures with metal armour.

action.name: Water Whip
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows a Way of the Four Elements to either knock a target prone, or pull a target towards them.
action.description: Possibly pulls a target within 9m toward you or knocks it Prone.

grants.name: Harmony of Fire and Water
grants.description: While not in combat, regain half of your ki|forceplural=y (rounded down).

options.name: Way of the Open Hand
options.description: You specialise in unarmed combat, using your hands and control of ki to heal or inflict grievous hurt.
options.image: Class Monk Open Hand Badge Icon.png

action.summary: PAGENAME is a bonus that allows the Monk to deal two unarmed strikes at their opponent. This skill does not have to come after an Attack or an action.
action.description: Punch twice in quick succession.

action.name: Flurry of Blows: Topple
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of the Open Hand bonus action that enhances your Flurry of Blows to knock your target prone.
action.description: Punch twice in quick succession and potentially knock the target Prone (Condition)|Prone.

action.name: Flurry of Blows: Stagger
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of the Open Hand bonus action that enhances your Flurry of Blows to stagger your target as well, preventing reactions as long as it connects.
action.description: Punch twice in quick succession and Open Hand Technique: Staggered (Condition)|Stagger the target, making it unable to take Reactions.

action.name: Flurry of Blows: Push
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of the Open Hand bonus action that enhances your Flurry of Blows to push your target away from you as well.
action.description: Punch twice in quick succession and potentially push your target m=5|ft=16 away.

action.name: Deflect Missiles
action.summary: Deflect Missiles is a Reaction gained by Monk at Level 3. Deflect Missiles allows the Monk to reduce incoming damage from ranged weapon attacks and optionally return the projectile.
action.description: Use your reaction to reduce the damage from a ranged weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level. If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Missile.

* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder

Your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

Requires Proficiency with Heavy Armour

:* Gain Proficiency with LightArmour.

grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Druid spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Wisdom.

options.name: Martial Adept
options.description:
Martial Adept|w=30
:* Learn two manoeuvres from the Short or Long Rest.

grants.name: Martial Adept
grants.description: Learn two manoeuvres from the Battle Master archetype and receive 1 (additional) supdie to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a Short or Long Rest.

options.name: Medium Armour Master
options.description:
Medium Armour Master|w=30
:* When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

grants.name: Medium Armour Master
grants.description:
When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to ArmourClass you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

You must have Proficiency in Medium Armor to take this feat

options.name: Mobile
options.description:
* Your Movement Speed increases by m=3|ft=10.

Mobile: Evade Difficult Terrain|w=30
:* When you use the Dash action, Difficult Terrain doesn't slow you down.

Mobile: Evade Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke an Opportunity Attack from that target.

grants.name: Mobile
grants.description:
* Your Movement Speed increases by m=3|ft=10.

Mobile: Evade Difficult Terrain|w=30
:* When you use the Dash action, Difficult Terrain doesn't slow you down.

Mobile: Evade Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke an Opportunity Attack from that target.

options.name: Moderately Armoured
options.description:
Moderately Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with MediumArmour and Shields.

grants.name: Moderately Armoured
grants.description:
You gain Proficiency with Medium Armour and Shields, and your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You must have Light Armor Proficiency before you can take this feat.
