options.description:
* Increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Gain Musical Instrument Proficiency.

grants.name: Performer
grants.description:
* Increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Gain Musical Instrument Proficiency.

options.name: Polearm Master
options.description:
Polearm Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When attacking with a Glaive, Halberd, Quarterstaff, or Spear, you can use a Bonus Action to attack with the butt of your weapon. 
:* Note: This attack deals 1d4 + Weapon Ability Modifier damage.

Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack|w=30
:* You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

grants.name: Polearm Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description:
When attacking with a Glaive, Halberd, Quarterstaff, or Spear, you can use a Bonus Action to attack with the butt of your weapon. 
This attack does 1d4|Bludgeoning|modifier=melee

grants.name: Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack
grants.description: You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

options.name: Resilient
options.description:
Resilient|w=30
:* You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency in that ability's SavingThrows.
:* Note: this increase does apply to a druid in wild shape.

grants.name: Resilient
grants.description:
You increase an Ability by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Gain Proficiency in that ability's SavingThrow.

options.name: Ritual Caster
options.description:
Ritual Caster: Free Spells|w=30
:* You learn two Ritual_Spell_Icon|24px Ritual Spells of your choice.
:* Note: the spell must be one of these:
:** Enhance Leap
:** Disguise Self
:** Find Familiar
:** Longstrider
:** Speak with Animals
:** Speak with Dead

grants.name: Ritual Caster: Free Spells
grants.description:
You learn two Ritual_Spell_Icon|24px Ritual Spells of your choice from the following: 
* Speak with Dead
* Find Familiar
* Longstrider
* Enhance Leap
* Disguise Self
* Speak with Animals

options.name: Savage Attacker
options.description:
Savage Attacker|w=30
:* When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

grants.name: Savage Attacker
grants.description: When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

options.name: Sentinel
options.description:
Sentinel: Vengeance|w=30
:* When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

Sentinel: Snare|w=30
:* When you hit a creature with an Attack of Opportunity, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

grants.name: Sentinel: Vengeance
grants.description: When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

grants.name: Sentinel: Snare
grants.description: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

grants.name: Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage
grants.description: You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

options.name: Sharpshooter
options.description:
Sharpshooter: Low Ground|w=30
:* Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

Sharpshooter: All In|w=30
:* Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Sharpshooter: Low Ground
grants.description: Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

grants.name: Sharpshooter: All In
grants.description:
Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.
(This is a toggleable passive effect)

options.name: Shield Master
options.description:
Shield Master|w=30
:* Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

Shield Master: Block|w=30
:* If a Spell forces you to make a Dexterity Saving Throw, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
:* Notes:
:** On a failed save, you only take half damage.
:** On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

grants.name: Shield Master
grants.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

grants.name: Shield Master: Block
grants.description:
If a Spell forces you to make a DEX, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

options.name: Skilled
options.description:
Skilled|w=30
:* You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

grants.name: Skilled
grants.description: You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

options.name: Spell Sniper
options.description:
Spell Sniper|w=30
:* You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
:* Notes:
:** The cantrip you learn must be one of these:
:*** Bone Chill
:*** Eldritch Blast
:*** Fire Bolt
:*** Ray of Frost
:*** Shocking Grasp
:*** Thorn Whip
:** These cantrips do scale with character level, just like a spellcaster's cantrips.

grants.name: Spell Sniper
grants.description:
You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

The cantrip must be one of:
* Bone Chill
* Eldritch Blast
* Fire Bolt
* Ray of Frost
* Shocking Grasp
* Thorn Whip

options.name: Tavern Brawler
options.description:
Tavern Brawler|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your strength modifier is added twice to the damage and Attack Rolls.Bug

grants.name: Tavern Brawler
grants.description:
Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1, to a maximum of 20.

When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your Strength Modifier is added twice to the damage and Attack Rolls.Bug

options.name: Tough
options.description:
Tough|w=30
:* Hit Point maximum increased by 2 for each level.

grants.name: Tough
grants.description: Your Hit Point maximum increases by 2 for every level you have gained.

options.name: War Caster
options.description:
War Caster: Concentration|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on SavingThrows to maintain Concentration on a Spell.

War Caster: Opportunity Spell|w=30
:* You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.
:* Note: this feat does not grant the cantrip Shocking Grasp. Unless you know it from another source, you can only  cast it as an Attack of Opportunity.

grants.name: War Caster: Concentration
grants.description: You gain Advantage on SavingThrows to maintain Concentration on a Spell.

grants.name: War Caster: Opportunity Spell
grants.description: You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.

options.name: Weapon Master
options.description:
Weapon Master|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.

action.name: Slow Fall
action.summary: Slow Fall is a Reaction gained by Monks at Level 4. Slow Fall allows the Monk to gain Resistance to falling damage.
action.description: When you fall, you can use your reaction to gain Resistance to Falling damage.

grants.name: Extra Attack
grants.description: You can make an additional free attack after making an unarmed or weapon attack.

action.name: Stunning Strike (Melee)
action.summary: Stunning Strike (Melee) is a Monk Action. This Action allows the Monk to deal damage to enemies with Melee Weapons and possibly Stun them.
action.description: Spend a ki to deal Weapon Damage and possibly Stunned|Stun the target.

action.name: Stunning Strike (Unarmed)
action.summary: Stunning Strike (Unarmed) is a Monk Action. This Action allows the Monk to deal damage to enemies with an Unarmed Strike and possibly Stun them.
action.description: Spend a ki to deal Unarmed Damage and possibly Stunned|Stun the target.

grants.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
grants.description: Your unarmed attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming enemies' Resistance and Immunity to non-magical damage.

options.name: Way of Shadow
options.description: You value the arts of stealth and subterfuge, bending the shadows to your will to strike without warning.

action.name: Shadow Step
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow bonus that allows you to enter the shadows and reappear at a distant location, granting you Advantage on your next attack.
action.description:
Teleport from shadow to shadow.

Afterwards, you have Advantage on your next melee Attack Roll.

options.name: Way of the Four Elements
options.description: You focus your ki to bend the elements to your will, using them as an extension of your own body.
options.image: Class Monk Four Elements Badge Icon.png

grants.name: Clench of the North Wind
grants.description: Hold a humanoid enemy still. They can't move, act or react. Attacks from within 3m are always critical hits.

action.name: Embrace of the Inferno
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to cast Scorching Ray as a class action. Embrace of the Inferno hurls 3 rays of fire at targets within range. You can either target a single creature or multiple creatures with the rays. Each ray rolls a separate Attack Roll and deals Fire damage.

action.name: Gong of the Summit
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows Way of the Four Elements to cast a monk version of the spell Shatter.
action.description: Damages all nearby creatures and objects. Creatures made of inorganic material such as stone have Disadvantage on their SavingThrow.

options.name: Way of the Open Hand
options.description: You specialise in unarmed combat, using your hands and control of ki to heal or inflict grievous hurt.
options.image: Class Monk Open Hand Badge Icon.png

grants.name: Manifestation of Body
grants.description: Your hands sap the ki from your enemies' bodies. Your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 + Wisdom Modifier|Necrotic damage.

grants.name: Manifestation of Mind
grants.description: Your hands sap the ki from your enemies' bodies. Your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 + Wisdom Modifier|Psychic damage.

grants.name: Manifestation of Soul
grants.description: Your hands sap the ki from your enemies' bodies. Your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 + Wisdom Modifier|Radiant damage.

action.name: Wholeness of Body
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action unique to Class Monk Open Hand Hotbar Icon|Way of the Open Hand, a subclass of Monk, that lets the monk regain Ki Points and have an extra bonus action.
action.description: Regain half your Ki and enter a temporary state of Wholeness of Body (Condition)|Wholeness where you regain Ki Points and have an extra bonus.

grants.name: Evasion
grants.description: Your agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain spells. When a spell or effect would deal half damage on a successful Dexterity Saving Throw, it deals no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.

grants.name: Stillness of Mind
grants.description: If you are Charmed or Frightened, you automatically cast Stillness of Mind to remove the condition.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

grants.name: Ability Improvement
grants.description:

* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Actor

* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Charger

:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:

options.description:

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

options.name: Way of Shadow
options.description: You value the arts of stealth and subterfuge, bending the shadows to your will to strike without warning.

options.name: Way of the Four Elements
options.description: You focus your ki to bend the elements to your will, using them as an extension of your own body.
options.image: Class Monk Four Elements Badge Icon.png

grants.name: Improved Elemental Casting
grants.description:
Your affinity with elemental ki deepens. Several of your offensive Four Elements features deal an additional dice of damage, your Clench of the North Wind can hold an additional creature, and your Embrace of the Inferno fires an extra ray.

* Fist of Four Thunders damage increases to 3d8|Thunder (from 2d8)
* Fist of Unbroken Air damage increases to 4d10|Bludgeoning (from 3d10)
* Sweeping Cinder Strike damage increases to 4d6|Fire (from 3d6)
* Touch of the Storm damage increases to 2d10|Lightning (from 1d10)
* Water Whip damage increases to 4d10|Thunder (from 3d10)
* Clench of the North Wind can hold an additional creature.
* Embrace of the Inferno fires an additional ray.
* Gong of the Summit damage increases to 4d8|Thunder (from 3d8)

action.name: Fist of Four Thunders
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to push creatures and objects away. It is the Monk equivalent of Thunderwave.
action.description: Release a wave of thunderous force that pushes away all creatures and objects.
action.notes: When creatures succeeds in saving, they will not be pushed back, but will still take half the damage.

action.name: Fist of Unbroken Air
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to punch an enemy at distance, sending them flying backwards..
action.description: Push the target back m=6|ft=20 and knock it Prone (Condition)|Prone.

action.name: Sweeping Cinder Strike
action.summary: PAGENAME is an action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies. This is the Monk's equivalent of Burning Hands.
action.description: Expel fire from your outstretched hands and ignite anything flammable.

action.name: Touch of the Storm
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to strike nearby enemies with lightning, causing them to be unable to use reactions. This is the Monk's equivalent of Shocking Grasp.
action.description: The target cannot use reactions. This spell has Advantage on creatures with metal armour.

action.name: Water Whip
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows a Way of the Four Elements to either knock a target prone, or pull a target towards them.
action.description: Possibly pulls a target within 9m toward you or knocks it Prone.

grants.name: Clench of the North Wind
grants.description: Hold a humanoid enemy still. They can't move, act or react. Attacks from within 3m are always critical hits.

action.name: Embrace of the Inferno
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows the Way of the Four Elements to cast Scorching Ray as a class action. Embrace of the Inferno hurls 3 rays of fire at targets within range. You can either target a single creature or multiple creatures with the rays. Each ray rolls a separate Attack Roll and deals Fire damage.

action.name: Gong of the Summit
action.summary: PAGENAME is an Action that allows Way of the Four Elements to cast a monk version of the spell Shatter.
action.description: Damages all nearby creatures and objects. Creatures made of inorganic material such as stone have Disadvantage on their SavingThrow.

options.name: Way of the Open Hand
options.description: You specialise in unarmed combat, using your hands and control of ki to heal or inflict grievous hurt.
options.image: Class Monk Open Hand Badge Icon.png

action.name: Ki Resonation: Punch (Action)
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of the Open Hand action that allows you to punch a target, activating the Ki within them. You can then detonate this Ki to cause an explosion.
action.description:
Hit a creature with your bare fists, making the ki in its body Resonating Ki|Resonate with yours.

You can then make this ki explode with Ki Resonation: Blast.

action.name: Ki Resonation: Punch (Bonus Action)
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of the Open Hand bonus action that allows you to punch a target, activating the Ki within them. You can then detonate this Ki to cause an explosion.
action.description:
Hit a creature with your bare fists, making the ki in its body Resonating Ki|Resonate with yours.

You can then make this ki explode with Ki Resonation: Blast.

action.name: Ki Resonation: Blast
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of the Open Hand free action that allows you to detonate the ki in anyone resonating with you. The explosion hits the creature and anyone nearby.
action.description:
Detonate the ki of a creature Resonating Ki|Resonating with you, hitting the creature and anyone within m=5|ft=16 of it.

The resulting explosion causes any nearby creatures Resonating with you to also detonate.

grants.name: Purity of Body
grants.description: You are Immune to Poison damage and can't be Poisoned or affected by disease thanks to the purifying ki flowing through your meridians.

action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow action that lets you strike from the shadows dealing Psychic damage
action.description: Teleport to a foe from a hidden position, striking them with the creeping, psychic ferocity of the shadows themselves.

action.name: Shadow Strike: Unarmed
action.summary: PAGENAME is a Way of Shadow action that lets you strike from the shadows with your fists, dealing Psychic damage.
action.description: Teleport to a foe from a hidden position, striking them with the creeping, psychic ferocity of the shadows themselves.

action.description: Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity

action.name: Mist Stance
action.summary: Way of the Four Elements equivalent of the level 3 Wizard spell Gaseous Form that can only target the caster.
action.description:
Transform into a tiny gas cloud. It can't fall, and fits through small openings. It is very hard to damage.

The cloud has Advantage on Constitution, Dexterity, and Strength SavingThrows.

While transformed, the target won't be able to attack, cast spells, or talk.

* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

* Thorn Whip

name: Paladin
description: Paladin is a character Class in Baldur's Gate 3. Paladins are masters of a variety of weapons and armour. They channel the power of their sacred oath to heal the sick and injured and to smite their foes. Important Ability Scores for Paladins include Strength (or Dexterity), Charisma, and Constitution.

action.name: Divine Sense
action.summary: Divine Sense is a Paladin Action. This ability allows them to briefly gain advantage on attacks against certain enemies.
action.description: Tap into your spiritual awareness to gain Advantage on Attack Rolls against celestials, fiends, and undead.

action.name: Lay on Hands
action.summary: Lay on Hands is a Paladin Action. This ability allows the Paladin to heal a creature or cure it of diseases and poisons.
action.description:
Use your blessed touch to heal a creature or cure it of all diseases and poisons.

No effect on undead and constructs.

options.name: Oath of Devotion
options.description: Following the ideal of the knight in shining armour, you act with honour and virtue to protect the weak and pursue the greater good.

action.name: Holy Rebuke
action.summary: Holy Rebuke is an Action available to Oath of Devotion. This ability allows these Paladins to grant a target a vengeful aura that damages the attacker each time the target is hit in melee.
action.description: Call upon your Oath to grant a vengeful aura that deals 1d4|Radiant damage to anyone who hits them with a melee attack.

options.name: Oath of the Ancients
options.description: You fight on the side of light in the cosmic struggle against darkness to preserve the sanctity of life and the beauty of nature.
options.image: Paladin Oath of the Ancients Icon.png

action.name: Healing Radiance
action.damage: amounttext:Proficiency Bonus + Paladin Level + Charisma Modifier, type:Healing
action.summary: Healing Radiance is a Bonus Action available to Oath of the Ancients. This ability allows these Paladins to channel their oath to heal allies in an area.
action.description:
Heal yourself and all nearby allies for Proficiency Bonus + Paladin Level + Charisma Modifier hit points. Regain another Proficiency Bonus + Paladin Level + Charisma Modifier hit points next turn.

No effect on undead and constructs.

options.name: Oath of Vengeance
options.description: You have set aside even your own purity to right wrongs and deliver justice to those who have committed the most grievous sins.

action.name: Inquisitor's Might
action.summary: Inquisitor's Might is a Bonus Action available to Oath of Vengeance. This ability allows these Paladins to grant a 2 turn single-target buff which causes their or their ally's weapon attacks to deal an additional +Charisma Radiant damage and can Dazed|Daze enemies for 1 turn.
action.description: You or an ally's weapon attacks deal an additional +Charisma Radiant damage and can Dazed|Daze enemies for 1 turn.

options.name: Oathbreaker
options.description: You have broken your sacred Oath in pursuit of power and ambition. Only darkness remains to fuel you now.

action.name: Spiteful Suffering
action.summary: Spiteful Suffering is an Action available to those that have chosen the path of the Oathbreaker. This ability allows these Paladins to steep their enemies in darkness, causing necrotic damage and leaving them vulnerable to attacks.
action.description: Steep an enemy in the darkness that churns within you. The target takes 1d4 + Charisma Modifier|Necrotic damage each turn and Attack Rolls against it have Advantage.

action.name: Divine Smite
action.summary: Divine Smite allows a Paladin to expend a Spell Slot to deal additional Radiant damage with a melee weapon attack.
action.description: Your weapon emanates divine might as you strike, dealing an additional 2d8|Radiant|drs=t damage. Deals an additional 1d8|Radiant|drs=t damage to Fiends and Undead.

grants.name: Divine Health
grants.description: The divine magic flowing within you prevents disease from affecting you.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Charger
options.description:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

options.name: Sentinel

:* When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

:* You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

options.name: Shield Master
options.description:
Shield Master|w=30
:* Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

Shield Master: Block|w=30
:* If a Spell forces you to make a Dexterity Saving Throw, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
:* Notes:
:** On a failed save, you only take half damage.
:** On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

grants.name: Shield Master
grants.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

grants.name: Shield Master: Block
grants.description:
If a Spell forces you to make a DEX, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

Spell Sniper|w=30
:* You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

:*** Fire Bolt
:*** Ray of Frost
:*** Shocking Grasp
:*** Thorn Whip
:** These cantrips do scale with character level, just like a spellcaster's cantrips.

grants.name: Spell Sniper

* Bone Chill

* Thorn Whip

options.name: War Caster

War Caster: Concentration|w=30

War Caster: Opportunity Spell|w=30
:* You can also use a Reaction to cast Shocking Grasp at a target moving out of melee range.
:* Note: this feat does not grant the cantrip Shocking Grasp. Unless you know it from another source, you can only  cast it as an Attack of Opportunity.

grants.name: War Caster: Opportunity Spell

grants.name: Weapon Master
grants.description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.

grants.name: Extra Attack
grants.description: You can make an additional free attack after making an unarmed or weapon attack.

grants.name: Aura of Protection
grants.description: You and nearby allies gain a bonus to SavingThrows equal to your Charisma modifier.

options.name: Oath of Devotion
options.description: Following the ideal of the knight in shining armour, you act with honour and virtue to protect the weak and pursue the greater good.

action.name: Aura of Devotion
action.summary: Aura of Devotion is a Class Feature of Oath of Devotion. This ability allows a Paladin to protect their allies from being Charmed.
action.description: You and any nearby allies can't be Charmed. The aura disappears if you fall Unconscious.

options.name: Oath of the Ancients
options.description: You fight on the side of light in the cosmic struggle against darkness to preserve the sanctity of life and the beauty of nature.
options.image: Paladin Oath of the Ancients Icon.png

grants.name: Aura of Warding
grants.description: You and any nearby allies take only half the damage from spells. The aura disappears if you fall Unconscious.

options.name: Oath of Vengeance
options.description: You have set aside even your own purity to right wrongs and deliver justice to those who have committed the most grievous sins.

grants.name: Relentless Avenger
grants.description: If you hit an enemy with an Opportunity Attack, your movement speed increases by 4.5m / 15ft on your next turn.

options.name: Oathbreaker
options.description: You have broken your sacred Oath in pursuit of power and ambition. Only darkness remains to fuel you now.

grants.name: Aura of Hate
grants.description: You and any nearby fiends (and undead) gain additional damage to melee weapon attacks equal to your Charisma Modifier. The aura disappears if you fall Unconscious.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

grants.name: Ability Improvement
grants.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Actor
options.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

grants.name: Alert

options.name: Athlete

grants.name: Athlete: Standing Up
grants.description: When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance also increases by 50%.

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

Dual Wielder|w=30
:* You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if your weapons aren't Light You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

grants.name: Dual Wielder: Bonus Armour Class
grants.description: You have a +1 bonus to ArmourClass while wielding a melee weapon in each hand.

grants.description: You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if the weapons you are wielding aren't Light. You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

options.name: Dungeon Delver

Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps|w=30

grants.name: Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps

:* Regain full Hit Points every time you take a Short Rest.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Cold
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Cold damage. In addition, when you deal Cold damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. In addition, when you deal Lightning damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Thunder damage. In addition, when you deal Thunder damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Great Weapon Master: All In|w=30

:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus that turn.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
grants.description: When attacking with Heavy melee weapons you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

action.name: Aura of Courage
action.summary: Aura of Courage is a Paladin Class Action. This ability allows a Paladin to protect their allies from fear.
action.description: You and any nearby allies can't be Frightened. The aura disappears if you fall Unconscious.

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack

name: Ranger
description: Ranger is a character Class in Baldur's Gate 3. In tune with nature and their surroundings, Rangers utilize both their knowledge of the wilds and spellcasting to pursue their prey. Important Ability Scores for Rangers include Dexterity (or Strength), Constitution, and Wisdom.

options.name: Beast Master
options.description: Beast Masters bind themselves to an animal companion, sharing an intelligent bond that flourishes in and out of combat.
options.image: Class Ranger Beast Master Badge Icon.png

action.name: Summon Companion
action.summary: Summon Companion is a Subclass Feature of Rangers learned immediately upon choosing the Beast Master subclass. This ability allows the Beast Master to call upon their animal companion to fight and aid them in combat.
action.description: Gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and fights alongside you.

action.name: Bear Companion
action.summary: Bear Companion is a variant of Summon Companion which is a Subclass Feature of Rangers learned immediately upon choosing the Beast Master subclass. This ability allows the Beast Master to call upon their animal companion to fight and aid them in combat.
action.description: Gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and fights alongside you.

action.name: Boar Companion
action.summary: Boar Companion is a variant of Summon Companion which is a Subclass Feature of Rangers learned immediately upon choosing the Beast Master subclass. This ability allows the Beast Master to call upon their animal companion to fight and aid them in combat.
action.description: Gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and fights alongside you.

action.name: Dire Raven Companion
action.summary: Dire Raven Companion is a variant of Summon Companion which is a Subclass Feature of Rangers learned immediately upon choosing the Beast Master subclass. This ability allows the Beast Master to call upon their animal companion to fight and aid them in combat.
action.description: Gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and fights alongside you.

grants.name: Wolf Companion

action.name: Wolf Spider Companion

options.name: Gloom Stalker
options.description: Emerging like a horrible gift from the envelope of darkness and shadow, you ambush and put down your foes before they can even scream.

action.name: Umbral Shroud
action.summary: Umbral Shroud is a Gloom Stalker Action that lets you become Invisible so long as you are enshrouded in shadows.
action.description:
Area must be Lightly or Heavily Obscured

Wrap yourself in shadows to become Umbral Shroud (Condition)|Invisible if you are obscured.

Invisibility ends early if you attack, cast another spell, take an action, or take damage

grants.name: Superior Darkvision
grants.description: Can see in the dark up to 24m.

grants.name: Dread Ambusher
grants.description:
You specialise in taking out foes swiftly and ruthlessly.

You gain a +3 bonus to Initiative.

On the first turn of combat, your Movement Speed increases by m=3|ft=10, and you can make an attack that deals an additional d8|Physical1d8 damage

action.name: Dread Ambusher: Hide
action.summary: Dread Ambusher: Hide is a Gloom Stalker Bonus Action. This ability allows Gloom Stalkers to use their Bonus Action to Hiding (Condition)|Hide from view.
action.description: Hide from enemies by succeeding at Stealth checks. Stick to the dark and avoid enemy sightlines. Attacking or casting a spell will reveal your location.

action.name: Disguise Self
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily change their appearance. While active, gain access to the action Dispel Disguise to end the effect.
action.description: Magically change all aspects of your appearance.
action.notes:
* Draconic Bloodline of Gold (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
* Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Eldritch Invocation Mask of Many Faces at level 2+.
* Can be used to gain race specific bonuses on equipment and dialogue options if the player disguises as the corresponding race.
* Since the spell changes Creature Size it can be used to fit through some entrances with size requirements.
* Allows using Speak with Dead on creatures you've killed yourself.

options.name: Hunter
options.description: Hunters seek the most dangerous prey in Faerûn, from ancient dragons to massive hordes of undead, and excel at slaying them all.

grants.name: Colossus Slayer
grants.description: Once per turn, your weapon attack deals an extra 1d8|Physical|drs=t damage if the target is below its hit point maximum.

action.name: Giant Killer
action.summary: Giant Killer is a Hunter Passive Feature. This ability allows them to make a melee attack and deal damage to large targets using their reaction.
action.description:
If a Large or bigger creature attacks you, you can use your Reaction to retaliate with a melee attack.

Prerequisite: You must be able to see the creature, and it must be within 1.5m / 5ft of you.

grants.name: Horde Breaker
grants.description:
Target two creatures standing close to each other, attacking them in quick succession.

Grants:
* Horde Breaker (Melee)|w=40
* Horde Breaker (Ranged)|w=40

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

grants.name: Ability Improvement
grants.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Actor
options.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

grants.name: Actor
grants.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Alert
options.description:
Alert|w=30
:* You gain a +5 bonus to Surprised.

grants.name: Alert
grants.description: You gain +5 to Initiative and can no longer be surprised.

options.name: Athlete
options.description:
Athlete: Standing Up|w=30
:* Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance also increases by 50%.

grants.name: Athlete: Standing Up
grants.description: When you are Prone, standing up uses significantly less movement. Your Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance also increases by 50%.

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

options.name: Crossbow Expert
options.description:
Crossbow Expert: Point-Blank|w=30
:* When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

Crossbow Expert: Wounding|w=30 
:* Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

grants.name: Crossbow Expert
grants.description:
Crossbow Expert: Point-Blank|w=30
:* When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

Crossbow Expert: Wounding|w=30 
:* Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

options.name: Defensive Duellist
options.description:
Defensive Duellist|w=30
:* When you are attacked with a melee attack while wielding a Finesse Weapon you are Proficient in, you can use a Reaction to increase your ArmourClass by your Proficiency Bonus, possibly causing the attack to miss.

grants.name: Defensive Duellist
grants.description: When you are attacked with a melee attack while wielding a Finesse Weapon you are Proficient in, you can use a Reaction to increase your ArmourClass by your Proficiency Bonus, possibly causing the attack to miss.

options.name: Dual Wielder
options.description:
Dual Wielder: Bonus Armour Class|w=30
:* You have a +1 bonus to ArmourClass while wielding a melee weapon in each hand.

Dual Wielder|w=30
:* You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if your weapons aren't Light You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

grants.name: Dual Wielder: Bonus Armour Class
grants.description: You have a +1 bonus to ArmourClass while wielding a melee weapon in each hand.

grants.name: Dual Wielder
grants.description: You can use Two-Weapon Fighting even if the weapons you are wielding aren't Light. You cannot dual-wield Heavy weapons.

options.name: Dungeon Delver
options.description:
Dungeon Delver: Perception|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on Perception checks made to detect hidden objects and on SavingThrows made to avoid or resist traps.

Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps|w=30
:* You gain Resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

grants.name: Dungeon Delver: Perception
grants.description: You have Advantage on Perception Checks made to detect hidden objects.

grants.name: Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps
grants.description: You have Advantage on Saving Throws made to avoid traps and Resistance to trap damage.

options.name: Durable
options.description:
Durable|w=30
:* Constitution increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Regain full Hit Points every time you take a Short Rest.

grants.name: Durable
grants.description: Regain full Hit Points every time you take a Short Rest.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Cold
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Cold damage. In addition, when you deal Cold damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. In addition, when you deal Lightning damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Fire damage. In addition, when you deal Fire damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Thunder damage. In addition, when you deal Thunder damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Great Weapon Master
options.description:
Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When an attack with a melee weapon lands a Critical Hit or kills a creature, you can make another melee weapon attack as a Bonus Action that turn.

Great Weapon Master: All In|w=30
:* When attacking with a Two-Handed or Versatile melee weapon (in both hands) that you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus that turn.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
grants.description: When attacking with Heavy melee weapons you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

options.name: Heavily Armoured
options.description:
Heavily Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with HeavyArmour.

grants.name: Heavily Armoured
grants.description:
You gain Proficiency with Heavy Armour and your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You must have Medium Armor Proficiency before you can take this feat.

options.name: Heavy Armour Master
options.description:
Heavy Armour Master|w=30
:* Increase your Strength by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

grants.name: Heavy Armour Master
grants.description:
Your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Incoming damage from non-magical attacks also decreases by 3 while you're wearing heavy armour.

Requires Proficiency with Heavy Armour

options.name: Lightly Armoured
options.description:
Lightly Armoured|w=30
:* Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.
:* Gain Proficiency with LightArmour.

grants.name: Lightly Armoured
grants.description: You gain Armour Proficiency with Light Armour and your Strength and Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

options.name: Magic Initiate: Bard
options.description:
Magic Initiate: Bard|w=30
:* Learn 2 Cantrips and a 1st-level Spell from the Bard spell list. You can cast the 1st-level Spell once per Spellcasting Ability for all three spells is Charisma.

grants.name: Magic Initiate: Bard
grants.description: You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the Bard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Long Rest. Your Spellcasting Modifier for all 3 spells is Charisma.

Martial Adept|w=30
:* Learn two manoeuvres from the Short or Long Rest.

grants.name: Martial Adept
grants.description: Learn two manoeuvres from the Battle Master archetype and receive 1 (additional) supdie to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a Short or Long Rest.

options.name: Medium Armour Master
options.description:
Medium Armour Master|w=30
:* When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

grants.name: Medium Armour Master
grants.description:
When you wear medium armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth checks. The bonus to ArmourClass you can gain from your Dexterity modifier also becomes +3 instead of +2.

You must have Proficiency in Medium Armor to take this feat

:* You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.

grants.name: Polearm Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description:

This attack does 1d4|Bludgeoning|modifier=melee

grants.name: Polearm Master: Opportunity Attack

Resilient|w=30

options.name: Savage Attacker
options.description:
Savage Attacker|w=30

grants.name: Savage Attacker

options.name: Sentinel
options.description:
Sentinel: Vengeance|w=30
:* When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

Sentinel: Snare|w=30
:* When you hit a creature with an Attack of Opportunity, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage|w=30
:* You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks.

grants.name: Sentinel: Vengeance
grants.description: When an enemy in melee range attacks an ally, you can use a Reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel feat.

grants.name: Sentinel: Snare
grants.description: When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.

grants.name: Sentinel: Opportunity Advantage

options.name: Sharpshooter

Sharpshooter: Low Ground|w=30
:* Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

Sharpshooter: All In|w=30

grants.description: Your ranged weapon attacks are not penalized for High Ground Rules.

grants.name: Sharpshooter: All In
grants.description:
Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage.

options.name: Shield Master
options.description:
Shield Master|w=30
:* Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

Shield Master: Block|w=30
:* If a Spell forces you to make a Dexterity Saving Throw, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
:* Notes:
:** On a failed save, you only take half damage.
:** On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

grants.name: Shield Master
grants.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows when wielding a Shield.

grants.name: Shield Master: Block
grants.description:
If a Spell forces you to make a DEX, you can use your Reaction to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage.
* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

options.name: Skilled

Skilled|w=30
:* You gain Proficiency in 3 Skills of your choice.

grants.name: Skilled

options.name: Spell Sniper
options.description:
Spell Sniper|w=30
:* You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Spell is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
:* Notes:
:** The cantrip you learn must be one of these:
:*** Bone Chill
:*** Eldritch Blast
:*** Fire Bolt
:*** Ray of Frost
:*** Shocking Grasp
:*** Thorn Whip
:** These cantrips do scale with character level, just like a spellcaster's cantrips.

grants.name: Weapon Master

Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.

grants.name: Extra Attack
grants.description: You can make an additional free attack after making an unarmed or weapon attack.

options.name: Beast Master
options.description: Beast Masters bind themselves to an animal companion, sharing an intelligent bond that flourishes in and out of combat.
options.image: Class Ranger Beast Master Badge Icon.png

grants.name: Exceptional Training
grants.description: Your summoned companions can now Dash, Disengage, and Help as a bonus.

options.name: Gloom Stalker
options.description: Emerging like a horrible gift from the envelope of darkness and shadow, you ambush and put down your foes before they can even scream.

grants.name: Iron Mind
grants.description: You gain Proficiency in Wisdom and Intelligence SavingThrows.

options.name: Hunter
options.description: Hunters seek the most dangerous prey in Faerûn, from ancient dragons to massive hordes of undead, and excel at slaying them all.

grants.name: Escape the Horde
grants.description: Opportunity Attacks against you have Disadvantage.

grants.name: Steel Will
grants.description: Advantage on SavingThrows against being Frightened.

grants.name: Multiattack Defense
grants.description: When a enemy attacks you, they suffer -4 penalty to additional Attack Rolls against you until start of their next turn.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

options.name: Actor

* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Cold

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Weapon Master
grants.description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Gain Proficiency with four Weapon types of your choice.

grants.name: Land's Stride: Difficult Terrain
grants.description: Difficult Terrain no longer slows you down.

action.name: Hide in Plain Sight
action.summary: Hide in Plain Sight is a Ranger class action that makes you Invisible and gives a +10 bonus to Checks as long as you stand still.
action.description: Camouflage yourself with your environment to become Invisible and gain a +10 bonus on Stealth Checks, as long as you stand still.

options.name: Beast Master
options.description: Beast Masters bind themselves to an animal companion, sharing an intelligent bond that flourishes in and out of combat.
options.image: Class Ranger Beast Master Badge Icon.png

grants.name: Bestial Fury
grants.description: Grants all your companions an extra attack.

options.name: Gloom Stalker
options.description: Emerging like a horrible gift from the envelope of darkness and shadow, you ambush and put down your foes before they can even scream.

grants.name: Stalker's Flurry
grants.description: When you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another one for free.

options.name: Hunter
options.description: Hunters seek the most dangerous prey in Faerûn, from ancient dragons to massive hordes of undead, and excel at slaying them all.

options.name: Ability Improvement
options.description:
Note: While technically not a Feat, Ability Improvement is offered within the Feat Selection menu.
* Increase one Ability Score by 2, or two Ability Scores by 1.
* You can't increase an Ability Score above 20 using this feature.

grants.name: Ability Improvement

options.name: Actor
options.description:
* Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
* Your Proficiency Bonus is also doubled for Deception and Performance checks. 
* Note: despite not mentioning this in the tooltip, the character also gains proficiency in these 2 skills if they didn't have those proficiencies yet (game version: 4.36.34458).

options.name: Charger
options.description:
Gain the following weapon attacks:

Charger: Weapon Attack|w=30
:* Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
:* Notes:
:** Use both an action and bonus action, move up to 9m, and make a melee attack with +5 damage.
:** This counts as a single weapon attack, not a full Action, so it is possible to follow up with abilities like Extra Attack.

Charger: Shove|w=30
:* Charge forward and Shove the first enemy in your way.
:* Notes:
:** Shove distance depends on your Strength and the target's weight.
:** This counts as a full Action.

options.name: Elemental Adept
options.description:
* Spells you cast ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. In addition, when you deal that type of damage with a Spell, you cannot roll a 1.

Damage resistance options are one of the following:
* Elemental Adept: Acid
* Elemental Adept: Cold
* Elemental Adept: Lightning
* Elemental Adept: Fire
* Elemental Adept: Thunder

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Acid
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Acid damage. In addition, when you deal Acid damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Cold
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Cold damage. In addition, when you deal Cold damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Lightning
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Lightning damage. In addition, when you deal Lightning damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Fire
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Fire damage. In addition, when you deal Fire damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

grants.name: Elemental Adept: Thunder
grants.description: Spells you cast ignore Resistance to Thunder damage. In addition, when you deal Thunder damage with a spell, you cannot roll a 1.

options.name: Great Weapon Master
options.description:
Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack|w=30
:* When an attack with a melee weapon lands a Critical Hit or kills a creature, you can make another melee weapon attack as a Bonus Action that turn.

Great Weapon Master: All In|w=30
:* When attacking with a Two-Handed or Versatile melee weapon (in both hands) that you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.
:* Note: This is a toggleable passive ability.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: Bonus Attack
grants.description: When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus that turn.

grants.name: Great Weapon Master: All In
grants.description: When attacking with Heavy melee weapons you are Proficient with, Attack Rolls take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.

* On a failed save, you only take half damage.
* On a successful save, you don't take any damage, even if you normally would.

grants.name: Weapon Master
grants.description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

name: Rogue
description: Rogue is a character Class in Baldur's Gate 3. Rogues are well versed in the art of stealth and rely on their resourcefulness to be in control of any challenging situation. Rogues use Dexterity as their primary ability score.

grants.name: Expertise (Subclass Feature)
grants.description: When a character gains this feature, they may choose two skills they are proficient in and gain expertise in both of those skills.

action.name: Sneak Attack (Melee)
action.summary:
Sneak Attack (Melee) is a Rogue Action. This ability allows the Rogue to exploit enemies' distraction and deal extra damage to their vulnerable spots with Melee Weapons. 

The weapon has to have the Finesse property (but can still utilize Strength if it is higher than Dexterity).

See also: Sneak Attack (Ranged)
action.description: Deal an extra 1d6 damage to a foe you have Advantage against. You can also use Sneak Attack if you have an ally within 1.5m / 5ft of the target and you don't have Disadvantage.

action.name: Sneak Attack (Ranged)
action.summary:
Sneak Attack (Ranged) is a Rogue Action. This ability allows the Rogue to exploit enemies' distraction and deal extra damage to their vulnerable spots with Ranged Weapons.

See also: Sneak Attack (Melee)
action.description: Deal an extra 1d6 damage to a foe you have Advantage against. You can also use Sneak Attack if you have an ally within 1.5m / 5ft of the target and you don't have Disadvantage.

action.name: Cunning Action: Dash
action.summary: Cunning Action: Dash is a Rogue Bonus Action. This ability allows Rogues to use their bonus action to double their movement speed.
action.description: Cover more distance this turn: double your movement speed.

action.name: Cunning Action: Disengage
action.summary: Cunning Action: Disengage is a Rogue Bonus Action. This ability allows Rogues to use their bonus action to disengage from enemies and avoid opportunity attack.
action.description: Retreat safely. Moving won't provoke Opportunity Attacks.

action.name: Cunning Action: Hide
action.summary: Cunning Action: Hide is a Rogue Bonus Action. This ability allows Rogues to use their Bonus Action to Hide from view.
action.description: Hide from enemies by succeeding at Stealth checks. Stick to the dark and avoid enemy sightlines. Attacking or casting a spell will reveal your location.

options.name: Arcane Trickster
options.description: Arcane Tricksters are rogues with a clever touch of magic, using illusions and enchantments to keep their opponents on the back foot.

action.name: Mage Hand
action.summary: It conjures a spectral hand that can interact with objects.
action.description:
Create a spectral hand that can manipulate and interact with objects.

Duration: 10 turns.

This cantrip can only be cast once per short rest.
action.notes: * Githyanki and Arcane Tricksters can cast a special version of Mage Hand that is invisible.

action.name: Acid Splash
action.summary: It deals Acid damage to enemies in a small area.
action.description: Throw a bubble of acid that damages each creature it hits.
action.notes: * In BG3, this cantrip is the only direct offensive area of effect option without the expenditure of resources that can be done on a per turn basis
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 2d6|Acid.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 3d6|Acid.

action.name: Blade Ward
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to become more resilient against physical damage.
action.description: Take only half the damage from Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing attacks.

action.name: Bone Chill
action.summary: It deals Necrotic damage and prevents the target from regaining Hit Points.
action.description: Prevent the target from healing until your next turn. An undead target receives Disadvantage on Attack Rolls.
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 2d8|Necrotic.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 3d8|Necrotic.

action.name: Dancing Lights
action.summary: It creates magical orbs of light that brighten an area.
action.description: Illuminate a m=9|ft=30 radius.

action.name: Fire Bolt
action.summary: It allows the caster to hurl a bolt of fire at an enemy.
action.description: Hurl a mote of fire.
action.notes:
* High Elf and High Half-Elf versions are from the Wizard spell list and scale hit rate off of Intelligence. You need to explicitly choose the class version to scale off of a separate stat.
** For example: for Sorcerer when selecting the spell in the keyboard interface this will be designated with CHA for the Sorcerer version that scales off of Charisma and INT for the race (Wizard) version that scales off of Intelligence.
action.higherLevels:
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d10|Fire Fire|1d10 Fire damage, for a total of 2d10|Fire.
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d10|Fire Fire|1d10 Fire damage, for a total of 3d10|Fire.

action.name: Friends
action.summary: It makes the caster appear more charismatic to the affected creature.
action.description:
Gain Advantage on Charisma Checks against a non-hostile creature.

In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.
action.notes: If cast on companions, they will lose 10 approval when the effect ends, regardless of difficulty.

action.name: Light
action.summary: It makes an object shed light in a small area.
action.description: Infuse an object with an aura of light. Only affects one target at a time.
action.notes: * When cast on a character, it will apply the effect to their active weapon.

action.name: Minor Illusion
action.summary: It conjures a simple illusion to distract creatures.
action.description:
Create an illusion that compels nearby creatures to investigate.

You can remain hidden while casting this spell.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

Duration: 10 turns.
action.notes:
* Illusions can cast a special version of Minor Illusion as a Bonus Action.
* Outside of combat, causes most NPCs to walk towards the illusion and surround it.
* During combat, this causes enemies to turn towards the illusion.
* Springs traps if cast on top of the trap
* Placed on top of a vent it prevents gas from coming out
* Will disappear if you concentrate on another spell, but will not break concentration for existing spells

action.name: Poison Spray
action.summary: This cantrip allows spellcasters to deal Poison damage to a target.
action.description: Project a puff of noxious gas, dealing 1d12|Poison to a target.
action.higherLevels:
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d12|Poison Poison|1d12 Poison damage, for a total of 2d12|Poison.
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d12|Poison Poison|1d12 Poison damage, for a total of 3d12|Poison.

action.name: Ray of Frost
action.summary: It deals Cold damage to the target and slows it down.
action.description: Reduces the target's Movement Speed by m=3|ft=10.
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases to 2d8|Cold.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases to 3d8|Cold.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
action.summary: It makes a melee attack that inflictsLightning damage and prevents the target from taking Reactions.
action.description: The target cannot use Reactions. This spell has Advantage on creatures with metal Armour.
action.notes: Characters with the War Caster: Opportunity Spell|War Caster feat can cast this cantrip on enemies moving out of their melee range as a reaction, even if they don't know this spell.
action.higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases to 2d8|Lightning.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases to 3d8|Lightning.

action.name: True Strike
action.summary: The caster gains Advantage on their next Attack Roll against the target.
action.description: Gain Advantage on your next Attack Roll.
action.notes:
* This cantrip is also granted to Rangers who pick Mage Breaker as their Favoured Enemy at level 1.
* The description of True Strike is among the more confusingly worded, and thus is prone to being misunderstood. To wit:
** Only the caster of this spell gains Advantage on their next attack against the affected target, never their allies.
** Only the first attack roll following the application of the condition gains Advantage. The condition is removed immediately afterward, whether the attack roll is a hit or a miss.
** The duration is 2 turns, but this includes the turn on which the condition is applied. This is true of many spells, but is especially important for short duration spells.
* True Strike is rarely considered worth using due to its opportunity cost; a full action must be spent on it to improve the chances of hitting once. Most of the time, if two actions are available (whether on the same turn or not), attacking twice is more effective than attacking once with advantage due to damage bonuses.
* However, True Strike is not considered aggressive, so the caster could cast it just before combat to gain its benefits without having to spend an action mid-fight. This eliminates the opportunity cost. Note that the duration is only 2 turns (12 seconds while not in turn-based mode).
* Another niche use case exists for an Arcane Trickster making a Sneak Attack (Melee)|Sneak Attack. If the caster is out of spell slots, and no allies can flank for a sneak attack, and there is no other way to gain advantage for an attack roll, spending a single action on True Strike to enable a single sneak attack can be considered efficient.
** In such cases, True Strike can be even more useful when using the Sneak Attack (Ranged)|ranged version of sneak attack, since this allows the caster to benefit from the range of the cantrip, especially with a High Ground bonus. At such distances, however, it is typically easier to just use a Bonus Action to hide first and obtain Advantage.

action.name: Charm Person
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature, granting Advantage on Charisma Checks.
action.description:
Charm a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain Advantage on Charisma Checks in dialogue.

Enemies have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed.

Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Colour Spray
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily blind enemies with flashing coloured light, making their attacks miss more often and shortening their attack range.
action.description: Blinded|Blind creatures up to a combined Healing|33 Hit Points.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level increases the number of targets by 1 and total Spell Slot Level above 1st.

action.name: Disguise Self
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily change their appearance. While active, gain access to the action Dispel Disguise to end the effect.
action.description: Magically change all aspects of your appearance.
action.notes:
* Draconic Bloodline of Gold (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
* Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Eldritch Invocation Mask of Many Faces at level 2+.
* Can be used to gain race specific bonuses on equipment and dialogue options if the player disguises as the corresponding race.
* Since the spell changes Creature Size it can be used to fit through some entrances with size requirements.
* Allows using Speak with Dead on creatures you've killed yourself.

action.name: Sleep
action.summary: It allows the spellcaster to temporarily make conscious creatures fall into a deep slumber.
action.description:
Put creatures into a magical slumber. Select targets up to a combined 24 Hit Points.

The condition ends upon taking damage.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Affect creatures with more hit points at higher levels. The total hit points of creatures this spell can affect is increased by 8 hit points per level.

action.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to send a targeted creature into a fit of laughter, falling Prone.
action.description:
Leave a creature Prone with laughter, without the ability to get up.

The creature must have an Intelligence of 5 or more.
The target can try to shake off the effect each time it takes damage.

action.name: Burning Hands
action.summary: It allows spellcasters to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies.
action.description:
Each flammable target is hit with 3d6|Fire Fire|damage.

On Save: Targets still take half damage.
action.notes: * Draconic Bloodline of Red (Fire) Ancestry learns this spell automatically.
action.higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional Fire|1d6 Fire damage per level.

action.name: Charm Person
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature, granting Advantage on Charisma Checks.

Enemies have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed.

Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.

action.name: Chromatic Orb
action.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fire a ball of energy and deal the desired damage type to enemies.
action.description:
Hurl a sphere of energy.

It deals 3d8|Thunder damage, or 2d8 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Poison damage and creates a surface.
action.notes: * Also granted to Warlocks who choose the Book of Ancient Secrets}} at level 7+. When gained in this way, the spell can be cast once per [[Long Rest and doesn't expend Spell Slots.
action.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra d8|Physical 1d8 damage of the chosen type for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.
